conclusion: Determine heat Q exchanged between gas and environment from state A to C.
State A: p_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3, T_A = -73°C = 200 K; State C: p_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate temperature at State C using ideal gas law.
Substitute known values into ideal gas law equation.
Change in internal energy ΔU = 200 J.
Calculate work done by gas from A to B: W_AB = 600 J.
Work done from B to C is zero because it is isochoric.
Apply first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Conclusion: Heat Q exchanged is 800 J.
